RoverApp

Class RoverControler

  • java.lang.Object
    • RoverApp.RoverControler

  • public class RoverControler
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is responsible for controlling the rover. Control logic of the rover is separated into this class. Each control signal (L,R,M) changes the state of the rover. Each method in this class will receive a rover object, update its state and return updated object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RoverControler() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Rover move(Rover rover)
      move method is used to rotate rover to left.
      Rover rotateL(Rover rover)
      rotateL method is used to rotate rover to left.
      Rover rotateR(Rover rover)
      rotateR method is used to rotate rover to right.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • RoverControler

        public RoverControler()

    • Method Detail

      • rotateL

        public Rover rotateL(Rover rover)
        rotateL method is used to rotate rover to left. It is invoked when L signal is received.
        Parameters:
        rover - is an object of rover class
        Returns:
        This returns the rover object with rover's heading direction updated

      • rotateR

        public Rover rotateR(Rover rover)
        rotateR method is used to rotate rover to right. It is invoked when R signal is received.
        Parameters:
        rover - is an object of rover class
        Returns:
        This returns the rover object with rover's heading direction updated

      • move

        public Rover move(Rover rover)
        move method is used to rotate rover to left. It is invoked when M signal is received.
        Parameters:
        rover - is an object of rover class
        Returns:
        This returns the rover object with rover's x and y coordinates updated
